**‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§É‚Äî**‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï, ‡§ï‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§≤‡•á‡§ñ‡§É‡•§

** ‡§∏‡§ø‡§ß‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú ‡§£ ‡§ú‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡•§ [ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§® ‡§ú‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡•§ ]

** ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§É‚Äî**‡§π‡•á ‡§ò‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§, ‡§≤‡•á‡§ñ‡•ã ‡§®‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§§‡•á ‡§® ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡•á ‡§ï‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡•§ ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•á ‡§§‡§æ‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡•Å‡•§ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç ‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§É ‡§ï‡•á‡§® ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

with true words to give [lit. cause to produce ]delight (priu)tothese friends too of ours, alliance (sandhi) with whom has already been [introduced i. e.] begun, by means of full (pra ) encouragement (utsƒÅhana) by the granting ( paripatana) of the reward of alli. ance which was previously promised. These two, being thus favoured, would resort to their benefactor (upakƒÅran) by [i. e.after] the destruction of their resort. This, not forgotten [by the truthful one], to be sure (eva), we are reminding the truthful one of. Some among these have a desire for the treasuare (kosa) and the elephant [-force] of the enemy, [while ] some [others ], for [his] territory (vi·π£aya). The [set of] three ornaments which the truthful one sent has been [duly] received. By me too has been sent something with a view to making the letter not quite insi gnificant (a-≈õumya). That should be [kindly ] accepted. And the verbal clue (vƒÅcika) should be heard from this SiddhƒÅrthaka, most worthy of being trusted.

** **Friend BhƒÅgurƒÅyana, what kind of letter [is ] this?

** BhƒÅgurƒÅyana‚Äî**Good [friend ] SiddhƒÅrthaka, whose letter [is] this?

**Siddharthaka‚Äî**Noble one, I do not know.

** BhagurƒÅya·πáa‚Äî**O knave ! the letter is being taken [by you all right], ‘whose it is’ is not known ! Let everything alone [lit, stand] for a while. By whom is the verbal clue to be heard from you ?

** ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**( ‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§®‡§æ‡§ü‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç ) ‡§§‡•Å‡§π‡•ã‡§π‡§ø‡§Ç [ ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§≠‡§ø‡§É¬∫]

** ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§É‚Äî**‡§ï‡§ø‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§≠‡§ø‡§É‡•§

** ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏‡•á‡§π‡§ø425 ‡§ó‡§ø‡§π‡•Ä‡§¶‡•ã ‡§£ ‡§Ü‡§£‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§£‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡•§ [ ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•à‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡•Ä‡§§‡•ã ‡§® ‡§ú‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§≠‡§£‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø‡•§ ]

** ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§É‚Äî**( ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ã‡§∑‡§Æ‡•ç ) ‡§è‡§∑ ‡§ú‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§∏‡§ø426‡•§ ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•Å‡§∞‡§ï, ‡§¨‡§π‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§§‡§æ‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§°‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§ï‡§•‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø‡•§

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**‡§ú‡§Ç ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡•ã‡§Ü‡§£‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡§ø‡•§ ( ‡§á‡§§‡§ø ‡§§‡•á‡§® ‡§∏‡§π ‡§®‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ) ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú ‡§á‡§Ö‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§≤‡•á‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§ø‡§¶‡§æ ‡§™‡•á‡§°‡§ø‡§Ü ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏ ‡§§‡§æ‡§°‡§ø‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏ ‡§ï‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡§æ‡§¶‡•ã ‡§µ‡§ø‡§°‡§ø‡§¶‡§æ‡•§[ ‡§Ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§• ‡§Ü‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§™‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø‡•§… ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§á‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§û‡•ç‡§õ‡§ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§™‡•á‡§ü‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§§‡§æ‡§°‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ï‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§§‡•ã ‡§®‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡•§ ]

** ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§É‚Äî**( ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø ) ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞, ‡§á‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§™‡§ø ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§®‡•à‡§µ‡•§

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**‡§∏‡§ñ‡•á, ‡§Ö‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§≤‡•á‡§ñ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•ã ‡§≠‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø‡•§ ‡§á‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Æ‡§™‡§ø ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡•á‡§™‡§æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§ü‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§Ø‡•§

( ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§É ‡§§‡§•‡§æ ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø )

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

** SiddhƒÅrthaka‚Äî**(Gesticulating fear ) By your worthy presences.

** BhƒÅgurƒÅyana‚Äî**What ? By us?

** SiddhƒÅrthaka‚Äî**By the honourable ones seized [ that I am ], I do not know what Ishould say. ]

** BhƒÅgurƒÅyana‚Äî**(With anger ) Here would you know [that presently]. BhƒÅsuraka, having been taken out, let [ this one] be thrashed till he tells [what he has been asked to].

** Purusa‚Äî**As the noble one commands. (With this, going out with him [and] entering again) Noble one, this casket bearing the stamp of the signet ring of RƒÅk·π£asa, fell down from his arm-pit, while he was being belaboured.

** BhƒÅgurƒÅyana‚Äî**(Beholding) Prince, this also is just marked with the stamp of the signet-ring of RƒÅk·π£asa.

** Malayaketu‚Äî**Friend, this must be the article [ given ] with a view to make the letter not quite insignificant (asunya). Preserving this stamp of the signet-ring to [ and ] opening, show [it to me ]

( BhƒÅgurƒÅya·πáa does accordingly and shows)

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**( ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø) ‡§Ö‡§Ø‡•á, ‡§§‡§¶‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡§æ‡§≠‡§∞‡§£‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§∂‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡§µ‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø427‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ó‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§≤‡•á‡§ñ‡§É‡•§

** ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§É‚Äî**‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞, ‡§è‡§™ ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§§ ‡§è‡§µ ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§∂‡§Ø‡§É‡•§ ‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞, ‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§∞‡§™‡§ø ‡§§‡§æ‡§°‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**‡§ú ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡•ã ‡§Ü‡§£‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡§ø‡•§ ( ‡§á‡§§‡§ø ‡§®‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡•á‡§® ‡§∏‡§π ‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø) ‡§è‡§∏‡•ã ‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡•Å ‡§§‡§æ‡§°‡§ø‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏ ‡§è‡§µ‡•ç‡§µ ‡§£‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡•á‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø ‡§≠‡§£‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡•§ [ ‡§Ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ü‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§™‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø… ‡§è‡§™ ‡§ñ‡§≤‡•Å ‡§§‡§æ‡§°‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§É ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡•à‡§µ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø ‡§≠‡§£‡§§‡§ø‡•§ ]

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**‡§§‡§•‡§æ ‡§≠‡§µ‡§§‡•Å428‡•§

** ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**( ‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø ) ‡§Ö‡§≠‡§è‡§£ ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§™‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§∞‡•á‡§¶‡•Å ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡•ã‡•§ [ ‡§Ö‡§≠‡§Ø‡•á‡§® ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‡•§ ]

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞, ‡§Ö‡§≠‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•á‡§µ ‡§™‡§∞‡§µ‡§§‡•ã ‡§ú‡§®‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡•§ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§•‡§æ‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç429‡•§

** ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**‡§£‡§ø‡§∏‡§æ‡§Æ‡•á‡§¶‡•Å ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ã ‡§Ö‡§π‡§Ç ‡§ñ‡•Å ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡§∏‡•á‡§£ ‡§á‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§≤‡•á‡§π‡§Ç ‡§¶‡•á‡§á‡§Ö ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡§Ü‡§∏ ‡§™‡•á‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ã‡•§ [ ‡§®‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§§‡•Å ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§π‡§Ç ‡§ñ‡§≤‡•ç‡§µ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡•á‡§®‡•á‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§≤‡•á‡§ñ ‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ó‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡•§ ]

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Æ‡§ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡•§

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

** Malavaketu‚Äî**(Beholding) Ah! this is the ornament sent by me, after having been taken off from my own person, to RƒÅk·π£asa. Evidently [ this is ] Candragupta’s letter.

** BhagurƒÅya·πáa‚Äî**Prince, here would the doubt be cleared up [Immediately ]. Good [man], let [ him] be belaboured even again.

** Puru·π£a‚Äî**As the noble one commands. ( With this goma out and entering again with SiddhƒÅrthaka) Here indeed, being belaboured, [he] says, ‚ÄòI shall tell [it] to the Prince himself.’

**Malayaketu‚Äî**So be it.

** Siddharthaka‚Äî**(Falling at the feet [of the Prince ] ) May the Printe do me a favour [ by granting me ] safety [lit. freedom from fear ].

** Malayaketu‚Äî**Good [man], there [ever ] is safety [ granted ] to a person, definitely, who is depedent on another [i. e. not his own master] Let [the whole story ] be narrated as it took place.

** Siddharthaka‚Äî**May the Prince listen. I was indeed sent by minister to [lit. in the neighbourhood ( sakƒÅ≈õam ) of ] Candragupta.

** Malayaketu‚Äî**I should now like to hear the verbal clue.

** ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§≤, ‡§Ü‡§¶‡§ø‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡•ã‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡•á‡§£ ‡§ú‡§π‡§æ‡§è‡§¶‡•á ‡§Æ‡§π ‡§™‡§ø‡§Ö‡§µ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏‡§æ ‡§™‡§û‡•ç‡§ö ‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ü‡§£‡•ã ( ‡§â‡§™‡§∏‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø ) ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ú‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‡•§

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§Ö‡§≠‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡•á‡•§ ‡§á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§•‡§æ ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ã‡§§‡§ø)

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§ö‡§ø‡§∞‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§®‡•á‡§®‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø445 ‡§µ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§ó‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§É‡•§

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî** ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞, ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡§®‡•Å‡§§‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•Å‡§™‡§æ‡§≤‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡•ã‡§Ω‡§ß‡§ø‡§ó‡§§‡§É‡•§

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡§æ‡§£‡•á ‡§ï‡§•‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡§ø ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡•§

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞, ‡§è‡§µ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§æ‡§É ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ø‡§®‡•ã ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§æ‡§®‡§É‡•§ ( ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡§ø ‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡•´-‡•ß‡•ß ‡§™‡§†‡§§‡§ø )

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

Having fixed his sight, with all its parts motionless, on the fore-part of [his] feet, [the sighr that] on account of its vacant nature, has not comprehended any particulars of that [object of sight ], supports ( rahati ) by [the i. e. on the palm of] his hand [his] moon-like face [made or bent ] low by the weight as it were of the undertakings, difficult to see through [or shoulder, lit. bear, (vah.)].

(Approaching) May the Prince be victorious !

** Malayaketu‚Äî**Noble one, I salute [you]. May this seat be occupied.

(Raksasa does accordingly )

**Malayaketu‚Äî**Noble one, at the sight of the Noble on [coning] after a long period of time, we are upset (or grived, ud-vignƒÅ·∏•).

** RƒÅk≈üasa‚Äî**Prince, by me [ busy ] making [all the necessary] counter-arrangements in regard to the [military] expedition, has this reproof (upƒÅlambha) by Your Excellency (kumƒÅrƒÅt) been earned.

** Malayaketu‚Äî**I wish to hear as to (iti) how the counterarrangements in regard to [our military] expedition have been made [by the Noble one ].

** RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî** Prince, thus have been directed the kings, the followers of the Prince. ( Recites Prasthatavyam ..etc, V-11 uttered before. )

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**(‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ó‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ) ‡§ï‡§•‡§Ç ‡§Ø ‡§è‡§µ ‡§Æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡§æ‡§∂‡•á‡§® ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ó‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§Ø‡§ø‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§ ‡§è‡§µ ‡§Æ‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§µ‡•É‡§£‡•ç‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡•§ ( ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç ) ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§ø ‡§ï‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É ‡§ï‡•Å‡§∏‡•Å‡§Æ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§Ç‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§ø ‡§ó‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡§ø ‡§§‡§§ ‡§Ü‡§ó‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡§ø ‡§µ‡§æ‡•§

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§Ö‡§µ‡§∏‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡§ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡•Ä‡§Ç ‡§ó‡§§‡§æ‡§ó‡§§‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§≤‡•ç‡§™‡•à‡§∞‡§π‡•ã446‡§≠‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§ó‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡§É447‡•§

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**( ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ó‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ) ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§Ø‡§§‡•á‡•§ ( ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç ) ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§§‡§§‡§É ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ø‡•á‡§Ç‡§£‡§æ‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§≤‡•á‡§ñ‡§É ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡•§

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**( ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø ) ‡§Ö‡§Ø‡•á ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‡•§ ‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞448, ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§

** ‡§∏‡§ø‡§ß‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**( ‡§∏‡§¨‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡§Ç449 ‡§≤‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§ü‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç ) ‡§™‡§∏‡•Ä‡§¶‡§¶‡•Å ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡•ã‡•§ ‡§§‡§æ‡§°‡•Ä‡§Ö‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•á‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§è ‡§£ ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡§ø‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§∞‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏‡§Ç ‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡§ø‡§¢‡•Å‡§Ç‡•§ [ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•Ä‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‡•§ ‡§§‡§æ‡§°‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•á‡§® ‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§® ‡§™‡§æ‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç ‡§∞‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡§Ø‡§ø‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ]

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞, ‡§ï‡•Ä‡§¶‡•É‡§∂‡§Ç ‡§∞‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡§ø ‡§® ‡§ñ‡§≤‡•ç‡§µ‡§µ‡§ó‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡•§

** ‡§∏‡§ø‡§ß‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**‡§£‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡§µ‡•á‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§§‡§æ‡§°‡§ø‡§Ö‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•á‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§è‡•§ [ ‡§®‡§®‡•Å ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§™‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§§‡§æ‡§°‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•á‡§® ‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§æ ]

( ‡§á‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§∏‡§≠‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ã‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§ø )

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

** Malayaketu‚Äî**( To himself) How, those very [persons ] who wish to worship Candragupta by my murder‚Äîjust those are surrounding me. (Aloud) Noble one, is there any one who is going to Kusumapura or is [Just] come from there ?

** Raksasa‚Äî**Finished now [is] the purpose of going and coming. In just (eva) a few days, we ourselves are reaching there.

** Malayaketu‚Äî**( To hamself ) [ By me ] is quite well under- stood [the real meaning of these words]. ( Aloud ) If [it is] so, why was this person, with a letter, sent by the Noble one?

** Raksasa‚Äî**(Beholdong) Ah‡•§ SiddhƒÅrthaka. Good [ friend ], what [is] this [you are about ] ?

** Siddharthaka‚Äî**( With tears, gesticulating shame) May the Minister be pleased. By me, being belaboured, it was not found possible to keep the secret.

** Raksasa‚Äî**Good [friend], I really do not understand as to what kind of secret [it is that you are referring to].

** SiddhƒÅrthaka‚Äî**I say, I humbly state, ’ by me, being belaboured…’

(With thas half stated, stands with face downcast, in fear)

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£, ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§®‡§É ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§≠‡•Ä‡§§‡•ã ‡§≤‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§ø‡§§‡•ã ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§®‡•à‡§µ ‡§ï‡§•‡§Ø‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø‡•§ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•á-‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§ï‡§•‡§Ø‡•§

** ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§É‚Äî**‡§Ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§™‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§É‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§è‡§∑ ‡§ï‡§•‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø ‡§Ø‡§•‡§æ‡§á‡§Æ- ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§® ‡§≤‡•á‡§ñ‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ó‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡§ø‡§§ ‡§á‡§§‡§ø‡•§

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï, ‡§Ö‡§™‡§ø ‡§∏‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§

** ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**( ‡§≤‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§®‡§æ‡§ü‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç ) ‡§è‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§Ö‡§§‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§°‡§ø‡§Ö‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•á‡§£ ‡§Æ‡§è ‡§£‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡§ø‡§¶‡§Ç‡•§ [ ‡§è‡§µ‡§Æ‡§§‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§°‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•á‡§® ‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ]

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§Ö‡§®‡•É‡§§‡§Æ‡•á‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡•§ ‡§§‡§æ‡§°‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§É ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§µ ‡§® ‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡•§

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**‡§∏‡§ñ‡•á ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£, ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§Ø ‡§≤‡•á‡§ñ‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑ ‡§≠‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É ‡§ï‡§•‡§Ø‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø‡•§

** ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§É‚Äî**‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§Ö‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§≤‡•á‡§ñ‡§É‡•§

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**( ‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡§Ø‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ450 ) ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞, ‡§∂‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó ‡§è‡§∑‡§É‡•§

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**‡§≤‡•á‡§ñ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•Ç‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§£‡•á‡§¶‡§Æ‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§≠‡§∞‡§£‡§Æ‡§®‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§ï‡§•‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó451 ‡§è‡§∑‡§É‡•§

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

** MƒÅlayaketu‚Äî**BhƒÅgurƒÅyaa, this one, [ either ] afraid [or] ashamed, would not tell in the presence of [his] master. Do you yourself tell it to the Noble one.

** BhƒÅguƒÅrƒÅyana‚Äî**As the Prince commands. Minister, this one tells Having been given a letter and told a message [which was to be ] the oral clue, I was sent by the Minister to Candragupta.

** RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî**Good [friend] SiddhƒÅrthaka, is [this ] true?

** SiddhƒÅrthaka‚Äî**(Gesticulating shame) This [lit. thus ] was told by me [when I was] being soundly beaten.

** Raksasa‚Äî**Untruth is this. What possibly would a person, [white] being beaten, not say?

** Malayaketu‚Äî**Friend BhagurƒÅyana, show the letter. The oral clue, this servant will tell.

** BhƒÅgurƒÅyana‚Äî**Minister here [is]the letter.

** RƒÅksasa‚Äî**[ Havrng read ( it ) ] Prince, a clever device (prayoga) of the enemy [is] this.

** Malayaketu‚Äî**In order to ensure that the letter did not remain quite insignificant (s≈´nya) [by itself ], by the Noble one, even this ornament was sent. Then how [is] this a clever device of the enemy?

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**( ‡§Ü‡§≠‡§∞‡§£‡§Ç ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø ) ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•á‡§£‡•à452‡§§‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§π‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§®‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§§‡§ï‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡•ã‡§∑‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§®‡•á ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§

** ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§É‚Äî** ‡§à‡§¶‡•É‡§∂‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø453 ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•á‡§∑‡§§‡§É ‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•á‡§£‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ó‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡§µ‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ó‡§≠‡•Ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡§É‡•§

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ454‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡§ø ‡§≤‡§ø‡§ñ‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§£‡•§

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§ï‡•Å‡§§‡•ã ‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§æ‡§ö‡§ø‡§ï‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§≤‡•á‡§ñ ‡§è‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§¶‡•Ä‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§® ‡§≠‡§µ‡§§‡§ø‡•§

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**‡§á‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§§‡§∞‡•ç‡§π‡§ø ‡§ï‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡•§

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§ï‡§™‡§ü‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡§ø‡§§‡•Å‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§®‡•Å‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø ‡§ß‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§É‡•§

** ‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ø‡§£‡§É‚Äî**‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞, ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ó‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§™‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø‡•§ ‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï, ‡§ï‡•á‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§≤‡§ø‡§ñ‡§ø‡§§‡•ã ‡§≤‡•á‡§ñ‡§É‡•§ ( ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡•ã ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡§Æ‡§µ‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§§‡•Ç‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Ä‡§Æ‡§ß‡•ã‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§ø )

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**(‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ó‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ) ‡§ï‡§•‡§Ç ‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§ò‡•É‡§§‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ç‡§£‡•Ä‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡•§ ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•á‡§µ‡§æ463 ‡§è‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡§ø dropped‡•§ “)‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§≠‡•Ç‡§∑‡§£‡§æ‡§®‡§ø ( ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç ) ‡§è‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡§ø ‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•á‡§® ‡§µ‡§£‡§ø‡§ó‡•ç‡§ú‡§®‡•á‡§®‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∏‡•Å ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§ø‡•§

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§§‡§æ‡§§‡•á‡§® ‡§ò‡•É‡§§‡§™‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ç‡§£‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•á‡§∑‡§§‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ó‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§ó‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡§æ ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡§ß‡§ø‡§ó‡§Æ‡§É ‡§ï‡§•‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•á‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§•‡§µ‡§æ ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§ ‡§è‡§µ‡•à‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡•§ ‡§ï‡•Å‡§§‡§É‡•§

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**(‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ó‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ) ‡§Ö‡§π‡•ã ‡§∏‡•Å‡§≤‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ã‡§Ω465 ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É‡•§")‡§≠‡•Ç‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§É‡•§ ‡§ï‡•Å‡§§‡§É‡•§

‡§≤‡•á‡§ñ‡•ã‡§Ω‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§® ‡§Æ‡§Æ‡•á‡§§‡§ø466 ‡§®‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡§ø‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§¶‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§Ø‡§§‡§É
‡§∏‡•å‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§ï‡§ü‡•á‡§® ‡§ñ‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡§ø ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡•á‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•á‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§ï‡§•‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

lustrous, like the evening of the autumnal season, made resplendent by the moon [risen] at its opening (mukha), and possessed of constellations.

** RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî**(To himself) How does [she] say formerly worn by Parvate≈õvara? Evidently [then these are ] his ornaments. (Aloud) These too were sold on to us by the merchantfolk employed by CƒÅ·πáakya.

** Malayaketu‚Äî**Noble one, of [ornaments] formerly worn by [my] father, especially of those that had fallen into [lit, gone to] the hunds of Candragupta, how does the acquisition by purchase stand to reason? Or, this does stand to reason [quite ] definitely (eva). Why?

By your honour ( bhavata), cruel [ at heart ], have we been fixed up as the price of these [ornaments] for Candragupta, the seller, desirous of a greater profit.

** RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî**(To himself) Oh ! the enemys’ device has been very systematically arranged (sushasta). Why ?

There is no reply [possible] to this effect ’this letter is not mine’, in so far as the signet-ring is mine. ‚ÄòBy Sakata, friendship has been broken’‚Äîhow would this [explanation] be credible? Who indeed would consider possible the sale of ornaments in the case [i.e. on the part]

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§ï‡•Å‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞, ‡§è‡§µ‡§Æ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§π‡§æ‡§∞‡§ø‡§£‡§æ469 ‡§≠‡§µ‡§§‡•à‡§µ ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§É470‡•§

(‘‡§Æ‡•å‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§Ω‡§∏‡•å ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§™‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§∞’ ‡§á‡§§‡§ø ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Æ‡§¶‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§¶‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ø‡•á‡§® ‡§™‡§†‡§§‡§ø )

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

of Maurya, lord of men ? A complete (sam) admission (pratipatti) itself, therefore, is better certainly (hi), in the matter (atra), [and] not a rustic (grƒÅmyam) reply.

**Malayayaketu‚Äî**This, I [ would] ask of the Noble one.

** Raksasa‚Äî**Prince, ask the one who is ‚Äònoble’. We have now become ‚Äòignoble’ [ones].

** Malayaketu‚Äî**

That Maurya [is] the son of your master [while ] I am the son of your friend, intent on waiting upon you. He is the giver of wealth to you, [while] following your own view you give me wealth. The post of the minister there, I say (nanu) [is] to you slavery [ and little more than that] attended [lit., preceded ] by honour, [the same] here [is] ths state of [being ] the master. An eager desire (samiha ) with regard to what greater self-interest, again, is making you an ignoble pesson ?

**RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî**Prince, the decision has been given by just your excellency ( bhavata), [thus ] making an improper statement.

(Repeats the verse Mauryosau svƒÅmiputra·∏•’ etc. with [the forms of the pronouns] ‘You’ and ‘I’interchanged)

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

Malayketu‚Äî (Pointing to the letter and the casket of ornaments) Now what [Is your explanation about] this?

RƒÅk≈üasa‚Äî(With tears) Destiny‚Äôs [wanton ] sport. Why ?

This is the ample [ i.e.wanton] sport of that Destiny, the destroyer (chid) of the efforts of men, by which sinful (pƒÅpin) one, were slain [k·π£atƒÅ·∏•‚Äìlit wounded] those lords of the earth of repute], [competent ] judges (parƒ™k·π£akƒÅh) of men, [in the esteem] of whom, ever greatfully remembering [the good turn] done [to them ] (k·πõtavedina·∏•) [and] with cultivated minds (k·πõtadh√≠ya·∏•) that they were, we were not different from their sons,‚Äî[even] while there was [on our part] the state of being [their] servants, the [veriest ] abode of insults (paribhƒÅvadhƒÅman), despite [also] the fact that they were the sovereign rulers (prabhavah).

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**(‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ó‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ) ‡§ï‡§•‡§Ç ‡§ú‡•Ä‡§µ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§∞‡§™‡§ø ‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§£‡§ø‡§ß‡§ø‡§É478‡•§‡§π‡§®‡•ç‡§§ ‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡•Å‡§≠‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡•á‡§Ç ‡§π‡•É‡§¶‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§™‡§ø ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**( ‡§∏‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç ) ‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•Å‡§∞‡§ï, ‡§Ü‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§∏‡•á‡§®‡§æ‡§™‡§§‡§ø‡§É ‡§∂‡§ø‡§ñ‡§∞‡§∏‡•á‡§®‡§É‡•§ ‡§Ø ‡§è‡§§‡•á ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡•á‡§® ‡§∏‡§π ‡§∏‡•Å‡§π‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∞‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§π‡•á‡§£ ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ó‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ß‡§Ø‡§ø‡§§‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§É

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

[repose] confidence [in you], reduced to the state (nita·∏•) of having only stories [about him] remaining [behind]. [And] now, we are about to be sold, like [a handful of] flesh, for our utter destruction (pra-laya), to the enemy, by your worthy presence (bhavatƒÅ) that has set a high value (ƒÅhatagaurava) on the office of [giving] counsel (mantra) [ to the enemy, Candragupta].

RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî( To himself) Here is another pimple [ grown] upon a boil. (Aloud, covering his ears ) Evil be deprecated, evil be deprecated. I did not employ the poison-maiden against Parv√°te≈õvara.

Malayaketu‚Äî By whom was then [my] father caused to be murdered?

** RƒÅk≈üasa‚Äî**Fate is to be asked [to give an answer] in this matter.

** Malayaketu‚Äî**(With anger) Fate is to be asked, not K·π£apa·πáaka Jivasiddhi.

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**‡§§‡§π480‡•§ [‡§§‡§•‡§æ‡•§] (‡§á‡§§‡§ø ‡§®‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É)

** ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‚Äî**‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏ ‡§®‡§æ‡§π‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§≠‡§ò‡§æ‡§§‡•Ä ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É ‡§ñ‡§≤‡•ç‡§µ‡§π‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§§‡§¶‡•ç‡§ó‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§æ481‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§∏‡§∞‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§®‡§æ ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ó‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§É‡•§ ‡§™‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡•§

‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§ó‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§Æ‡•å‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§Æ‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ó‡§§‡•å ‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ø‡§æ‡•§

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

Candragupta by plotting against (droha) our person‚Äî[the five viz.,] Citravarman of Kul≈´ta; Si·πÅhanƒÅda king of Malaya; Pu≈ükarƒÅksa of Kashmira; Sindhusena, king of Sindhu; [and] MeghanƒÅda, the lord of PƒÅrasƒ´kas‚Äîthe first three among these long for my territory.‚Äîthey having been led to a deep pit (svabhra), should be burried deep under earth [lit. by means of particles of earth ]. The other two, however, eagarly wishing [to have my ] elephant‚Äìforce should be put to death by [being trampled under the feet of] an elephant itself.

Puru≈üa‚Äî Accordingly [shall I do] (With this he goes out)

Malayaketu‚ÄîRƒÅksasa, I am not [RƒÅk·π£asa] demon, murdering [a person] by [taking him into] confidence. I am, indeed, Malayaketu‚ÄîGo then and let Candragupta be resorted to with all your heart (sarvƒÅtmanƒÅ). See

Vi·π£·πáugupta and [also] Maurya, even [when ] come with you [as the third], I am able to uproot, like bad policy (durnayah), [able to uproot ] the group of the three [secular objects of human life viz., Dharma, Artha and KƒÅma].

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**(‡§∏‡§æ‡§µ‡•á‡§ó‡§Æ‡•ç) ‡§π‡§æ ‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§§‡•á‡§Ω‡§™‡§ø ‡§ò‡§æ‡§§‡§ø‡§§‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø485‡§∏‡•ç‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡§É‡•§ ‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§ï‡§•‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§π‡•É‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡§æ‡§∂‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§§‡•á ‡§® ‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡•Å‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡§æ‡§∂‡§æ‡§Ø‡•§ ‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§ï‡§ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É ‡§ï‡§∞‡§µ‡§æ‡§£‡§ø‡•§

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

BhƒÅgurƒÅyana‚ÄîPrince, away with wasting time. Nolet our armies march [forthwith ] for besieging Kusumapura.

Let columns of the armies taking their being (labdhƒÅt malƒÅbhƒÅ·∏•) thanks to the stamping (k·π£oda) by the folded (pu·π≠a) hoofs of the horses, fall on the heads (uttamƒÅriga) of the enemies, [-columns of dust-] with their roots [i.e. bases of the earth,] cut off by the water of the ichor of the elephants [flowing profusely and covering the earth], rendering smoky [in the process], the cheeks of the Gaudi women, white with the fragrant paint (paramala) of the pollen (dhiili) of the lodhra-flowers [and] obscuring (kls ntƒÅh lit, afflicting) the dark hue (k·πõ·π£iumƒÅ), of their curly (ku√±cata) hair, glistening like swarms of bees.

(Exit Malayaketu with his retinue )

Even those poor ones, headed by Citravarman, have been put to death. How then [is it that] RƒÅk·π£asa actafor the destruction of his friends, not for that of the enemies IThen what shall I unfortunate [that I am ], do now?

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

Shall I repair to a penance-grove? [But my] mind with [the feeling of] animosity [still affecting it] would not attain peace by penance. Shall I follow [my] masters [in death] ? [but] while the enemy is [yet] alive, this is the right course (yogyata) for women to follow. Or shall I, with the sword as companion, fall on the army of the enemy? This also would not be proper. My mind‚Äî if it is not ungrateful‚Äî impatient (rabhasam) for the release of CandanadƒÅsa, would obstruct [me from taking recourse to the last alternative].

(With this exit)

Thus ends the Fifth Act called

ACT VI
(Then enter Siddharthaka decked and in joy)

SiddhƒÅrthaka‚ÄîVictorious isKe≈õava, dark [ lit, ‚Äòblue ] like a cloud, the killer of [ the demon ] Ke≈õin. And victorious is Candragupta, the moon, the eyes of the People, Victorious is the policy of revered CƒÅnakya, which has put down the enemy‚Äôs side, having accomplished every purpose (kƒÅryam), without exception,( yƒÅvat sarvam) of the means of victory (jayana).

I shall (tƒÅvat) see [my] dear friend, SamiddhƒÅrthaka after a long time. (Walking about and beholding) Here my dear friend SamiddhƒÅrthaka is coming over just here. I shall just approach him.

(Then enter SamiddhƒÅrthaka)

\‡§∏‡§Ç‡§§‡§æ‡§™‡•á ‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡•á‡§∂‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§ó‡•á‡§π‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡•á ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§æ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§

** ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî** (‡§â‡§™‡§∏‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø) ‡§ï‡§π‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§§‡•ç‡§•‡§ì‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§µ‡§ø ‡§∏‡•Å‡§π ‡§™‡§ø‡§Ö‡§ö‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•§ [‡§ï‡§•‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§™‡§ø ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡•§] (‡§á‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§≤‡§ø‡§ô‡•ç‡§ó‡§§‡§É)

** ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**‡§µ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏ ‡§ï‡•Å‡§¶‡•ã ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§∏‡•Å‡§π‡§Ç‡§ú‡•á‡§£ ‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ ‡§ö‡§ø‡§∞‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§™‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§ó‡§¶‡•ã ‡§µ‡§ø ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú ‡§£ ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§ó‡•á‡§π‡§Ç‡§Ü‡§Ö‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§∏‡§ø‡•§ [ ‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§ï‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•ã ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ñ‡§Ç ‡§Ø‡•á‡§® ‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§ö‡§ø‡§∞‡§Æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ó‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§™‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§® ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§ó‡•á‡§π‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ó‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§∏‡§ø‡•§ ]

** ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**‡§™‡§∏‡•Ä‡§¶‡§¶‡•Å ‡§µ ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏‡•ã‡•§ ‡§¶‡§ø‡§†‡•ç‡§†‡§Æ‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•ã ‡§è‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡•á‡§® ‡§Ü‡§£‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•ã‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ú‡§π ‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§§‡•ç‡§•‡§Ö ‡§ó‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§Ç ‡§è‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§™‡§ø‡§ì‡§¶‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç491 ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡•á‡§∞‡§ø‡§£‡•ã ‡§£‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡•á‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡•§

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

SamiddhƒÅrthaka‚Äî

Prosperous circumstances (vibkava·∏•) cause griet (d≈´na-yanayanti)[to people] in the absence of [lit. separation from] friends, present in their [the people’s] heart, the moons‚Äô [lit. lords or stars] in extreme trouble (santƒÅpa), [and] who enjoy pleasures on the occasion of festivities at the house.

SiddhƒÅrthaka‚Äî (Approachung) How [ it, is ] SamiddhƒÅrthaka. Is [my] dear friend happy ? ( With this, the two embrace each other)

SamiddhƒÅrthaka‚Äî Friend, whence could I be happy, as (yena) you, though returned after a long journey, are not coming to my house?

** ‡§∏‡§ø‡§ß‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**‡§µ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏, ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ‡§ó‡§¶‡•Ä‡§è497 ‡§µ‡§ø‡§Ö ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•Å‡§£‡§ø‡§¶‡§ó‡§¶‡•Ä‡§è498 ‡§£‡§Æ‡•ã ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§£‡•Ä‡§¶‡§ø‡§è‡•§ [ ‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§¶‡•à‡§µ‡§ó‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§á‡§µ‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Å‡§§‡§ó‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à ‡§®‡§Æ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§®‡•Ä‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•à‡•§]

** ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ß‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî** ‡§µ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏,‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡§∏‡•ã ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§π‡§ø‡§Ç‡•§ [‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É ‡§∏‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Ç ‡§ï‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•§ ]

** ‡§∏‡§ø‡§ß‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ø502‡§≠‡§µ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≤‡•ã‡§≤‡•á ‡§¨‡§°‡•ç‡§¢‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£‡•á ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ö‡§ï‡•á‡§¶‡•Å‡§ï‡§°‡§Ü‡§¶‡•ã ‡§£‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§Æ‡§ø‡§Ö ‡§â‡§¶‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡§£‡§æ‡§Æ‡§π‡•á‡§è‡§£ ‡§ö‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§Ö‡§£‡•Å503‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ò‡§ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£‡•ã ‡§á‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§™‡§æ‡§°‡§≤‡§ø‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§Ü‡§Ö‡§¶‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§£‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡§ø‡§¶‡§Ç‡•§ [‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§≠‡§Ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§≤‡•ã‡§≤‡•á ‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•á ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å ‡§ï‡§ü‡§ï‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•á‡§Ø‡•á‡§® ‡§ö‡§∞‡•á‡§£‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ß‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§® ‡§á‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§™‡§æ‡§ü‡§≤‡§ø‡§™‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ó‡§§ ‡§á‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ]

** ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ß‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**‡§µ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏, ‡§§‡§π‡§æ ‡§£‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡§∏‡•ã ‡§£‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§∞‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§™‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§Ö‡§£‡•á ‡§ï‡§ø‡§¶‡§µ‡•ç‡§µ‡§µ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ì ‡§£‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§Æ‡§ø‡§Ö ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§Ö‡§ï‡§ø‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§™‡•Å‡§£‡•ã‡§µ‡§ø ‡§á‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§™‡§æ‡§°‡§≤‡§ø‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§Ü‡§Ö‡§¶‡•ã ‡§è‡§µ‡•ç‡§µ‡•§ [‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ ‡§§‡§•‡§æ ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡•ã ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§Ø‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§Ø‡§®‡•á ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§®‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§É ‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§∞‡§™‡•Ä‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§™‡§æ‡§ü‡§≤‡§ø‡§™‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ó‡§§ ‡§è‡§µ‡•§ ]

** ‡§∏‡§ø‡§ß‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**‡§µ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏, ‡§§‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡•á‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§£‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§∏‡§ø‡§£‡•á‡§π‡•á‡§£‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡•§ [‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§§‡§∞‡•ç‡§ï‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡•á‡§π‡•á‡§®‡•á‡§§‡§ø‡•§]

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

** SiddhƒÅrtbaka‚Äî**An extra-ordinary (ati) simpleton you are, now that you wish to fathom the doings (carita) of revered.Ca·πáakya, not fathomed before by even minister R√°k·π£asa.

** SamiddhƒÅrthaka‚Äî**Friend, where [ is ] Minister RƒÅk·π£asa now ?

** SiddhƒÅrthaka‚Äî**It has been reported to revered CƒÅnakya that when that commotion (vilola) through fear began to increase, [he] having got out of the camp of Malayaketu, closely, followed (anusandhayamƒÅna·∏•) by a spy, Udumbara by name has come here to PƒÅ·π≠aliputra.

** SamiddhƒÅrthaka‚Äî**Friend, minister RƒÅk·π£asa, having indeed escaped, in that manner, with a resolve made in regard to the restoration of the kingdom of the Nandas, has in point of fact (eva) now come back again here to PƒÅ»õaliputra, without his goal [object, artha] being achieved !

**SiddhƒÅrthaka‚Äî**Friend, I guess [ RƒÅk·π£asa has come back to PƒÅtalipuara] on account of [his] affection for CandanadƒÅsa.

** ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ß‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É**‚Äî‡§µ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•ç‡§∏, ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§£‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏‡§Æ‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§Ö ‡§™‡•á‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡§æ504‡§Æ‡§ø‡•• [ ‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø,‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§Æ‡§ø‡§µ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á‡•§ ]

**‡§∏‡§ø‡§ß‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**‡§ï‡•Å‡§¶‡•ã ‡§∏‡•á ‡§Ö‡§ò‡§£‡•ç‡§£‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏ ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡•ã‡•§ ‡§∏‡•ã ‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡•Å ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏ ‡§Ü‡§£‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä‡§è ‡§¶‡•Å‡§µ‡•á‡§π‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§Ö‡§π‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§π‡§ø‡§µ‡§ú‡•ç‡§≠‡§ü‡•ç‡§†‡§æ‡§£‡§Ç ‡§™‡§µ‡•ã‡§∏‡•á‡§Ö ‡§µ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§π‡§¶‡§µ‡•ç‡§µ‡•ã‡•§ [‡§ï‡•Å‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ß‡§®‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§≠‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§É‡•§ ‡§∏ ‡§ñ‡§≤‡•Å ‡§∏‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§®‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡§ø‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‡•§ ]

** ‡§∏‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ß‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**(‡§∏‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§ß‡§Æ‡•ç) ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ò‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ö‡§ú‡§£‡•ã ‡§Ö‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•ã ‡§£‡§§‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§ú‡•á‡§£ ‡§Ö‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡•á ‡§à‡§¶‡§ø‡§∏‡•á‡§∏‡•Å505 ‡§Ö‡§¶‡§ø‡§£‡§ø‡§∏‡§∏‡•á‡§∏‡•Å ‡§£‡§ø‡§ì‡§è‡§Æ‡•Å ‡§£‡§ø‡§ì‡§è‡§¶‡§ø‡•§ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ò‡§æ‡§§‡§ï‡§ú‡§®‡•ã‡§Ω‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§®‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§ø ‡§Ø‡•á‡§®‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§Æ‡•Ä‡§¶‡•É‡§∂‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡§ø‡§®‡•É‡§∂‡§Ç‡§∏‡•á‡§∑‡•Å ‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ú‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø‡•§ ]

** ‡§∏‡§ø‡§ß‡•ç‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§ï‡§É‚Äî**‡§µ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏,‡§ï‡•ã ‡§ú‡•Ä‡§µ‡§≤‡•ã‡§è ‡§ú‡•Ä‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ã ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏ ‡§Ü‡§£‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø ‡§™‡§°‡§ø‡§ä‡§≤‡•á‡§¶‡§ø‡•§ ‡§§‡§æ ‡§è‡§π‡§ø ‡§ö‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§æ‡§≤‡•á‡§µ‡§∏‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡§ø‡§£‡§æ ‡§≠‡§µ‡§ø‡§Ö ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§£‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ú‡•ç‡§ù‡§ü‡•ç‡§ü‡§æ‡§£‡§Ç ‡§£‡§è‡§Æ‡•§ [ ‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§ú‡•Ä‡§µ‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡•á ‡§ú‡•Ä‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§ø‡§ï‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø ‡§§‡§¶‡•á‡§¶‡§ø ‡§ö‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§æ‡§≤‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡§ø‡§£‡•å ‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§æ‡§®‡§Ç ‡§®‡§Ø‡§æ‡§µ‡§É‡•§] (‡§á‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡•Å‡§≠‡•å ‡§®‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•å)

‡§á‡§§‡§ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡§ï‡§É‡•§

(‡§§‡§§‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§§‡§ø ‡§∞‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡•Å‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§É‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É)

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

** SamiddhƒÅrthaka‚Äî** Friend, I anticipate (prek·π£e) the release as though of CandanadƒÅsa.

** SiddhƒÅrthaka‚Äî**When [could there be] the release of this luckless one? He is indeed, at the command of revered CƒÅnakya, having been led ro the execution-ground, to be killed now, by the two of us.

** SamiddhƒÅrthaka‚Äî**(With anger) What? Has revered CƒÅ·πáakya no other executing-staff (ghƒÅtaka-jarah) that be appoints us two to such duties [that are] extremely cruel ?

** SiddhƒÅrthaka‚Äî**Friend, who in the world of the living, desirous of living, would [dare] counteract the command of revered CƒÅ·πáakya? Then, come along. Having put on the guise of executioners, let us take CandanadƒÅsa to the place of execution.

(With this, exeunt)
(Thus ends the Interlude)
(Then enter a man, with a rope in his hand)

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**

‡§õ‡§ó‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§£‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ú‡•ã‡§Ö‡§¶‡§ø‡§¢‡§æ‡§â‡§µ‡§æ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§°‡§ø‡§ò‡§°‡§ø‡§Ö‡§™‡§æ‡§∏‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ä‡•§
‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§£‡•Ä‡§¶‡§ø‡§∞‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡•Ç ‡§∞‡§ø‡§â‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ú‡§Æ‡§£‡•Å‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§Ü ‡§ú‡§≠‡§¶‡§ø‡••‡•™‡••

[‡§∑‡§°‡•ç‡§ó‡•Å‡§£‡§∏‡§Ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§ó‡§¶‡•ç‡§¶‡§¢‡§æ ‡§â‡§™‡§æ‡§Ø‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡§æ‡§ü‡§ø‡§ò‡§ü‡§ø‡§§‡§™‡§æ‡§∂‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ñ‡•Ä‡•§
‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§®‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø‡§∞‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡•Ç ‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡•Å‡§∏‡§Ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§®‡•ã‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§ú‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø‡••‡•™‡•• ]

[‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§µ‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ö ] ‡§è‡§∏‡•ã ‡§∏‡•ã ‡§™‡§¶‡•á‡§∏‡•ã ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏ ‡§â‡§¶‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§ï‡§π‡§ø‡§¶‡•ã ‡§ú‡§π‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡§è ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§æ‡§£‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä‡§è ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡§∏‡•ã ‡§™‡•á‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡§ø‡§¶‡§µ‡•ç‡§µ‡•ã‡•§ ( ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø ) ‡§ï‡§π‡§Ç‡§è‡§∏‡•ã ‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡•Å ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡§∏‡•ã ‡§ï‡§ø‡§¶‡§∏‡•Ä506‡§∏‡§æ‡§µ‡§ó‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§†‡§£‡•ã ‡§á‡§¶‡•ã ‡§è‡§µ‡•ç‡§µ ‡§Ü‡§Ö‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§¶‡§ø‡•§ ‡§§‡§æ ‡§ú‡§æ‡§µ ‡§π‡§Æ‡•á‡§π‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§ú‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§æ‡§£‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§µ‡•á‡§π‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§Ö‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§ø‡§¶‡§∏‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ã ‡§™‡•á‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§ï‡§π‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§Ü‡§∏‡§£‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§ó‡•ç‡§ó‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ã‡§¶‡§ø ‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡•§ [ ‡§è‡§∑ ‡§∏ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡•á‡§∂ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡•ã‡§¶‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§ï‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡•ã ‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ø‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‡•§…‡§ï‡§•‡§Æ‡•á‡§∑ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§≤‡•ç‡§µ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§∂‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§µ‡§ó‡•Å‡§£‡•ç‡§†‡§® ‡§á‡§§ ‡§è‡§µ‡§æ‡§ó‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§§‡§ø‡•§ ‡§§‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§µ‡§¶‡•á‡§≠‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§ú‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡•ã‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§™‡•à‡§∞‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡§∂‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∞‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§ï‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§∏‡§®‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ã‡§§‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø‡•§ ] (‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§§‡§É)

(‡§§‡§§‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§§‡§ø ‡§Ø‡§•‡§æ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§É ‡§∏‡§∂‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É)

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

** Puru·π£a‚Äî**

The rope in the form of CƒÅ·πáakya‚Äôs policy, strong (d·πõdhƒÅ) on account of the six; strings [also expedients] (gurƒÅh), with the grip (mukha) of the noose ( pƒÅ≈õa) formed by a series (paripƒÅti) of efforts [lit, means, (upƒÅya)] [puriningly, with a series of diplomatic schems], ready to bind down the enemy-folk, is victorious.

(Walkrng about and beholding ) Here [ is ] that region which was reported by Udumbar (kathitƒÅh) to revered CƒÅnakya [and] where, by revered CƒÅnakya’s, order, minister RƒÅk·π£asa is to be seen by me. (Beholding ) How ! Here indeed is minister RƒÅk·π£asa coming over just here, with his head [wrapped i.e. ] screened. So I shall just see, with [my] body screened by these trees in the old garden, [as to] where [he] takes [his] seat.

(Walking about, stands)
(Then enter RƒÅk·π£asa, as described)

Royalty has gone like a wanton woman, to another family (gotra) nervous on account of the resort having been cut off. ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§µ‡§¶‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Æ‡§¶‡§∂‡§æ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å‡§≤‡§≠‡•á ‡§≠‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§∂‡§ø‡§≤‡§æ‡§§‡§≤‡•á ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§π‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•Å‡§™‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡•§ (‡§â‡§™‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ö ) ‡§Ö‡§Ø‡•á, ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ï‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ï‡§É ‡§™‡§ü‡•Å‡§™‡§ü‡§π‡§∂‡§ô‡•ç‡§ñ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã ‡§®‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•Ä‡§®‡§æ‡§¶‡§É524 ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•á‡•§ ‡§Ø ‡§è‡§∑‡§É

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

The hooded ones [pha·π£ena·∏•, serpents], who are hissing up, are out of compassion for the extreme affliction of those intimately known, bandaging as it were with films [lit. bits cheda ] of their slough ( narmoka ), the wounds of the branches of the trees, with their limbs (i.e.parts) injured by sharp huge axes [and] wailing [through pain], by the incessant moaning of the pigeons.

And here the poor (tapasvina·∏•) trees showing pointedly (udagrayanta·∏•) the drying up within their body [i.e.the trunks] bearing the holes (k·π£ati, wrought into them ) by the insects, like very heavy grief, gloomy on account of the absence of [lit. separation from ] shade [punningly, lustre, chƒÅyƒÅ], [and] plunged into distress, are as though on the eve of [lit. have begun, pravrttƒÅh] their departure to the cemetary.

I shall [then] sit down for a while (yƒÅvat), on a borken slab of stone, easy to have in this unfavourable (vi-·π£ama) change (parvirƒÅma) of condition. ( Sitting down and lastening ) Ah! How (or why, kim) is this auspicious sound of trumpets, mixed with [that of big kettle-drums (pa·π≠upa·π≠aha·∏•), risen, who knows from where (ƒÅkasmika), [i.e.suddenly] being heard? This here‚Äî

(‡§µ‡§ø‡§ö‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø) ‡§Ü‡§É ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§è‡§∑ ‡§π‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§≤‡§Ø‡§ï‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§∏‡§Ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§®‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ú‡§æ‡§§‡•ã526 ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ú‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø(‡§á‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡•ã‡§Ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§∏‡§æ‡§∏‡•Ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç) ‡§Æ‡•å‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ß‡§ø‡§ï527‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡•ã‡§∑‡§Ç ‡§™‡§ø‡§∂‡•Å‡§®‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø‡•§ (‡§∏‡§¨‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡§Æ‡•ç) ‡§ï‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Ç ‡§≠‡•ã‡§É ‡§ï‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§

‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∂‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§∞‡§≠‡§ø‡§®‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§ö ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§ø‡§§‡§É‡•§

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É528‡•§ “‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É ( ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ó‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç )‡•§")‚Äî**‡§Ü‡§∏‡•Ä‡§£‡•ã ‡§Ö‡§Ö‡§Ç‡•§ ‡§ú‡•Ä‡§µ ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§∏‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§Æ‡§ø‡•§[ ‡§Ü‡§∏‡•Ä‡§®‡•ã‡§Ω‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§µ‡§¶‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡•á‡§∂‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡•§ ]

( ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§Æ‡§™‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§µ ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ã ‡§∞‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡•Å‡§™‡§æ‡§∂‡•á‡§® ‡§ï‡§£‡•ç‡§†‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§¨‡§ß‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§§‡§ø )

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

[i. e.] the auspicious sound of trumpets, mixed with the noise of big kettle-drums, stunning ( pramrdgan) the by-no-means strong (asƒÅra) passage [i. e. cavity] of the ears of the hearers, on account of its [ the former’s ] intensity (guratƒÅ), being as though drunk up andinstantaneously (sapadƒ±) thrown out by the mansions on account of [its] large quantity (bahutva), proceeds, possessed of curiosity as though, to see the extent [lit., length] of the quarters.

(Thinking) Ah ! ascertained [ it now is by me ]. This, certainly (hi ) arisen out of the capture [lit. binding down ] of Malayaketu indicates the extreme gratification of the royal family (with this half said, with jealously)‚Äîof the Maurya family. Alast Oh, alas !

I was made to hear the glory [prosperity]of the enemy, and having been brought [near the same ne] made to see it; methinks now [there is ] an effort on the part of Fate to cause me to experience [the same].

Puru·π£a‚ÄîThis one has taken his seat. I shall [then] just execute the command of revered CƒÅ·πáakya.

(Not seeing RƒÅk·π£asa as though, he ties up his neck by the noose of the rope, in front of him ).

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**(‡§µ‡§ø‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø) ‡§Ö‡§Ø‡•á, ‡§ï‡§•‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§¨‡§ß‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§§‡§ø‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§π‡§Æ‡§ø‡§µ ‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§ñ‡§ø‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡•§ ‡§≠‡§µ‡§§‡•Å ‡§™‡•É‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§â‡§™‡§∏‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø) ‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞, ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§¶‡§Æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§§‡•á‡•§

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**(‡§∏‡§¨‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡§Æ‡•ç) ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú, ‡§ú ‡§™‡§ø‡§Ö‡§µ529‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§∏‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§ñ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ã ‡§Ü‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§ø‡§∏‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§≠‡§ó‡•ç‡§ó‡•ã ‡§Ö‡§£‡•Å‡§ö‡§ø‡§ü‡•ç‡§†‡§¶‡§ø‡•§ [‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡§æ‡§∂‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§ñ‡§ø‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§¶‡•É‡§∂‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§Ω‡§®‡•Å‡§§‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§§‡§ø‡•§]

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**(‡§Ü‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ó‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç) ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§•‡§Æ‡§Æ‡•á‡§µ ‡§Æ‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§§‡§Ç ‡§®‡•Ç‡§®‡§Æ‡§π‡§Æ‡§ø‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§™‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø‡•§ (‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç) ‡§π‡•á ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡§®‡§¨‡•ç‡§∞‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ö‡§æ‡§∞‡§ø‡§®‡•ç, ‡§Ø‡§¶‡§ø ‡§® ‡§ó‡•Å‡§π‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç530 ‡§®‡§æ‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§§‡§§‡§É ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡•§

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú, ‡§£ ‡§∞‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏‡§Ç ‡§£‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§Ö ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ç‡§¶‡•Å ‡§£ ‡§∏‡§ï‡•ç‡§£‡•ã‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§™‡§ø‡§Ö‡§µ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏‡§µ‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§∏‡§¶‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡§ø‡§¶‡§π‡§ø ‡§Ö‡§ì ‡§è‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§∞‡§£‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§π‡§∞‡§£‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡•Å‡§Ç‡•§ [‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§® ‡§∞‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§®‡§æ‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§ï‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§§‡•Å ‡§® ‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§®‡•ã‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡§æ‡§∂‡§¶‡•Å‡§É‡§ñ‡§ø‡§§‡§π‡•É‡§¶‡§Ø ‡§è‡§§‡§æ‡§µ‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§Æ‡§™‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§∞‡§£‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§π‡§∞‡§£‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§]

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**(‡§®‡§ø‡§É‡§∂‡•ç‡§µ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ó‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ) ‡§ï‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Æ‡•á‡§§‡•á ‡§∏‡•Å‡§π‡•É‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡§®‡•á‡§∑‡•Å ‡§™‡§∞‡§™‡§¶‡•Å‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡•Ä‡§®‡§æ‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§π‡•á ‡§µ‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§®‡•á‡§®‡•§(‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç ) ‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞, ‡§Ø‡§¶‡§ø ‡§® ‡§∞‡§π‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§®‡§æ‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§§‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡•§

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî( Behaldang) Ah!How does thisone stragle him. self ? The poor one [is], like myself, afflicted. Be it [as it is] I shall ask him. ( Approaching ) Good [friend], what is this being done [ by you]?

Purusa‚ÄîNoble one, what [one who is unfortunate like us does, being] afflicted with the loss of a dear friend.

RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî( To himself ) Even from the beginning [lit, first ] it was known by me that [ this one is ], like myself, an afflicted (ƒÅxta) person, to be pitied (tapasvi ) [lit., poor ]. ( Aloud) O co-student in difficulty, if it be not a secret or [ something] extremely depressing [ hit, heavy ], I shall like to hear [about your calamity ].

Puru·π£a‚Äî Noble one, it is neither a secret nor [something] very depressing [or important ], but with [my] heart afflicted by the loss of [my] dear friend, I am not able to bear [lit. cause]even this much delay in death.

RƒÅk≈üasa‚Äî(Saghing, to himself) Alas ! Here are we, indifferent, like strangers, to the [lit. in the ] difficulties of friends”, being repudiated. (Aloud ) Good [friend], if [it is ] not a secret, nor very important, I would like to hear [about it].

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**(‡§Ü‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ó‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç) ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡§∞‡§Æ‡§∏‡•Å‡§π‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡•§ (‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç ) ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡•§

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**‡§∏‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§Æ ‡§™‡§ø‡§Ö‡§µ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏‡•ã‡•§ [ ‡§∏ ‡§Æ‡§Æ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§™‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É ] ‡•§

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî** (‡§∏‡§π‡§∞‡•ç‡§™‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ó‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ) ‡§Ö‡§Ø‡•á, ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§á‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§á‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡§Ç‡§®‡§ø‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§É‡§∏‡§Ç‡§¨‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡§É‡•§ ‡§á‡§®‡•ç‡§§ ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§¶‡•Ä‡§£532‡§ú‡§£‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§£‡•ç‡§£‡§æ‡§≠‡§∞‡§£‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§π‡§µ‡•ã ‡§ú‡§≤‡§£‡§Ç ‡§™‡§µ‡•á‡§∏‡§ø‡§¶‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ã ‡§£‡§Ö‡§∞‡§æ‡§¶‡•ã‡§£‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ã‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§π‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø ‡§ú‡§æ‡§µ ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏ ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•Å‡§£‡§ø‡§¶‡§µ‡•ç‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§£ ‡§∏‡•Å‡§£‡•ã‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§§‡§æ‡§µ‡§Ö‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§£‡§Ç ‡§â‡§¨‡•ç‡§¨‡§®‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§Ö‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§æ‡§µ‡§æ‡§¶‡§á‡§¶‡•Å‡§Ç ‡§á‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§ú‡§ø‡§£‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§æ‡§£‡§Ç ‡§Ü‡§Ö‡§¶‡•ã‡•§ [‡§∏‡§Ç‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§ø ‡§¶‡•Ä‡§®‡§ú‡§®‡§¶‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§≠‡§∞‡§£‡§æ‡§¶‡§ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§µ‡•ã‡§ú‡•ç‡§µ‡§≤‡§®‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•Å‡§ï‡§æ‡§Æ‡•ã‡§®‡§ó‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§π‡§Æ‡§™‡§ø ‡§Ø‡§æ‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§® ‡§∂‡•É‡§£‡•ã‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§§‡§æ‡§µ‡§¶‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡•Å‡§¶‡•ç‡§¨‡•Å‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡§ø‡§§‡•Å‡§Ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡§Ç‡§¶ ‡§ú‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡•ã‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§®‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ó‡§§‡§É‡•§]

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
Puru·π£a‚ÄîOh the importunity (mrbandha·∏•) on the part of the Noble one ! What [other] course [is there] ? I shall tell [it]. Here in this city there is a leading (sre·π£·π≠h√Ø) Jeweller, VisnudƒÅsa by name.

RƒÅk≈üasa‚Äî(To himself) Vi·π£·πáudƒÅsa is a very intimate (parama) friend of CandanadƒÅsa. (Aloud ) What [in respect ] of him?

Puru·π£a‚ÄîHe [is ] my dear friend‚Äî

RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî(With joy, to himself) Ah ! [He] said ‚Äò(my) dear friend‚Äô. Extremely close is the relation, Oh joy (hanta), [this one] would [definitely] know [some] account relating to CandanadƒÅsa.

Puru·π£a‚Äî[and] has after having given away his rich possessions (vrbhava) such as the ornaments etc., to the poor people, now gone out of the city, desirous of entering into fire. I too have come to this old garden to strangle myself to death (udbadhya vyƒÅpƒÅdayƒ±tum), even before I (yƒÅvat na tƒÅvat) hear what should not be heard [i.e. the news of the death] of him.

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞, ‡§Ö‡§ó‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡•á ‡§∏‡•Å‡§π‡•É‡§¶‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§ï‡•ã ‡§π‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§É‡•§

‡§ï‡§ø‡§Æ‡•å‡§∑‡§ß‡§™‡§•‡§æ‡§§‡§ø‡§ó‡•à‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡§π‡§§‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§π‡§æ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ß‡§ø‡§≠‡§ø‡§É

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**‡§£ ‡§π‡§ø ‡§£ ‡§π‡§ø‡•§ [ ‡§® ‡§π‡§ø ‡§® ‡§π‡§ø‡•§]

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî‡§ï‡§ø‡§Æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç‡§®‡§∞‡§™‡§§‡•á‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§É ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡•Å‡§ß‡§æ‡•§**

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî[]533**‡§è‡§¶‡§Ç533 ‡§µ‡§ø ‡§£‡§§‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡•§ ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏ ‡§ú‡§®‡§µ‡§¶‡•á ‡§£ ‡§£‡§ø‡§∏‡§Ç‡§∏‡§æ ‡§™‡§°‡§ø‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•Ä [ ‡§è‡§§‡§¶‡§™‡§ø ‡§®‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡•§ ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ó‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§ú‡§®‡§™‡§¶‡•á ‡§® ‡§®‡•É‡§∂‡§Ç‡§∏‡§æ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§É‡•§ ]

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§Ö‡§≤‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Æ534‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§®‡§æ‡§∞‡•Ä‡§ú‡§®‡§Æ‡•ç

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**(‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡•å ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ß‡§æ‡§Ø) ‡§∏‡§®‡•ç‡§§ ‡§™‡§æ‡§µ‡§Ç‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§≠‡•Ç‡§Æ‡•Ä ‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡•Å ‡§è‡§∏‡•ã ‡§Ö‡§µ‡§ø‡§£‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏‡•§ [‡§∂‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§ ‡§™‡§æ‡§™‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§≠‡•Ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡§É ‡§ñ‡§≤‡•ç‡§µ‡•á‡§∑‡•ã‡§Ω‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡•§ ]

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§ï‡§ø‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§≠‡§µ‡§§‡•ã ‡§Ø‡§•‡§æ ‡§∏‡•Å‡§π‡•É‡§¶ ‡§è‡§µ ‡§®‡§æ‡§∂‡•ã‡§Ω‡§µ‡§∂‡§É‡••‡•ß‡•¨‡••

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî** ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú, ‡§Ö‡§π ‡§á‡§Ç‡•§ [ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§Ö‡§• ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ]

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

** RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî**What is the cause of your friend‚Äôs entering into fire? Is he affected [lit., struck] by grave diseases, lying [lit.going] past the range (patha) of medicine?

** Puru·π£a‚Äî**No, to be sure, no.

** RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî**Has he been hurled down (mrasta·∏•) by the anger of the lord of men, next only ( kalpa ) to fire and poison?

** Puru·π£a‚Äî**Not this either [is the cause]. No wicked attitude (pratapatti) [is ever possible or likely] in Candragupta’s kingdom.[or, the attitune of Candragupta towards people in his kingdom [ janapada) is not cruel ].

** RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî**Has this one fallen in love with another’s wife impossible of having [for himself] ?

** Puru·π£a‚Äî**(Covering his ears) Evil be deprecated. This one is indeed no person [lit., ground] of such immodesty (a-vinaya) [lit., ill breeding ].

** RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî**Is there of this one, as of your honour, loss of just [his] friend, over which there is no control ( avasrah) ?

** Puru·π£a‚Äî**Noble one, what else ?

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**(‡§∏‡§æ‡§µ‡•á‡§ó‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ó‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç) ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®535‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§∏‡•Å‡§π‡•É‡§¶‡§ø‡§§‡§ø ‡§§‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡§æ‡§∂‡•ã ‡§π‡•Å‡§§‡§≠‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡§π‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡§ø ‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§ö‡§≤‡§ø‡§§536‡§Æ‡•á‡§µ‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡•á‡§π‡§™‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§¶‡•É‡§¶‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ (‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç) ‡§§‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡§æ‡§∂‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§∏‡•Å‡§π‡•É‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§≤‡§§‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§∏‡§ø‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡•Å‡§ö‡§∞‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç ‡§ö ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•ã‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§ø‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡•§

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú, ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ã ‡§Ö‡§µ‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§£ ‡§∏‡§ï‡•ç‡§£‡•ã‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§≠‡§ó‡•ç‡§ó‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§∞‡§£‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ó‡•ç‡§ò‡§∏‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡•ã‡§¶‡•á‡§¶‡•Å‡•§ [‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§Ö‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§™‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§® ‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§®‡•ã‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§≠‡§æ‡§ó‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§∞‡§£‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ò‡•ç‡§®‡§Æ‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡§ø‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ]

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞537, ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§£‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§•‡§æ ‡§ï‡§•‡§Ø‡•§

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**‡§ï‡§æ ‡§ó‡§á‡•§ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§æ‡§¶‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§è‡§∏‡•ã ‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡•Å ‡§£‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡•á‡§Æ‡§ø‡•§ ‡§∏‡•Å‡§£‡•ã‡§¶‡•Å ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡•ã‡•§ [‡§ï‡§æ‡§É ‡§ó‡§§‡§ø‡§É‡•§ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç‡•§ ‡§è‡§∑ ‡§ñ‡§≤‡•Å ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡•§ ‡§∂‡•É‡§£‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§É‡•§]

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞, ‡§Ö‡§µ‡§π‡§ø‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡•§

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**‡§Ö‡§§‡•ç‡§•‡§ø ‡§è‡§§‡•ç‡§• ‡§£‡§Ö‡§∞‡•á ‡§Æ‡§£‡§ø538‡§Ü‡§∞‡§∏‡•á‡§ü‡•ç‡§†‡§ø ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§£‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡•ã ‡§£‡§æ‡§Æ‡•§ [ ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§®‡§ó‡§∞‡•á ‡§Æ‡§£‡§ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•Ä ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡•ã ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡•§ ]

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî
RƒÅksasa‚Äî(With emotion, to himself) [ He ] is the dear friend of CandanadƒÅsa; therefore, his [CandanadƒÅsa’s ] destruction [ must be ] the cause of [his i e. Visnudasa’s] entering into fire. At this thought (iti) truth to tell ( yat satyam), my heart is literally (eva) trembling (calitam) out of partiality [ or admiration ] for the proper [kind of] affection ( yukta sneha ) [ shown ]. ( Aloud ) His destruction and the excellent course of the conduct (sucarita) of the one who is resolved to die out of affection for the dear friend‚Äî[ both these] I should like to hear in detail (vistarena).

** **Puru·π£a‚ÄîNoble one, unfortunate [that I am ], I cannot afford to cause [any] other obstruction after this, to [my] death.

** RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî**Good [ friend ] tell the story [ which is ] worth hearing.

Puru·π£a‚Äî What [other] course ? What should be done ? Here indeed shall I tell. May the Noble one listen.

** RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî**Good [ friend ], I am attentive.

**Puru·π£a‚Äî**In this city there is the President of the Guild of Jewellers, CandanadƒÅsa by name.

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**(‡§∏‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§æ‡§¶‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ó‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç) ‡§è‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§¶‡§™‡§æ‡§µ‡•É‡§§‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡•ã‡§ï539‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§∞‡§Ç ‡§¶‡•à‡§µ‡•á‡§®‡•§ ‡§π‡•É‡§¶‡§Ø, ‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø‡§∞‡•Ä‡§≠‡§µ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Æ‡§™‡§ø ‡§§‡•á ‡§ï‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§§‡§∞‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§®‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡•§ (‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§Æ‡•ç) ‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞, ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Ç‡§Ø‡§§‡•á ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§≤‡§É ‡§∏ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§É‡•§ ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡•§

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**‡§∏‡•ã ‡§è‡§¶‡§∏‡•ç‡§§ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏ ‡§™‡§ø‡§Ö‡§µ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏‡•ã ‡§π‡•ã‡§¶‡§ø‡•§ [ ‡§∏ ‡§è‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã ‡§≠‡§µ‡§§‡§ø‡•§]

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**(‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ó‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç540) ‡§∏‡•ã‡§Ω‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§≠‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§É ‡§∂‡•ã‡§ï‡§µ‡§ú‡•ç‡§∞‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡•ã ‡§π‡•É‡§¶‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡•§

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**‡§§‡§¶‡•ã ‡§µ‡§ø‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡•á‡§£ ‡§µ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏‡§Æ‡§ø‡§£‡•á‡§π‡§∏‡§∞‡§ø‡§∏‡§Ç ‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡•ã ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•ã‡•§ [‡§§‡§§‡•ã ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡•á‡§® ‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡•á‡§π‡§∏‡§¶‡•É‡§∂‡§Æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§§‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞‡§ó‡•Å‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡§É‡•§ ]

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§ï‡§•‡§Ø ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡§ø‡•§

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**‡§¶‡•á‡§µ, ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§•‡§ø ‡§Æ‡•á‡§ó‡•á‡§π‡•á ‡§™‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•ã541 ‡§Ö‡§§‡•ç‡§•‡•ã‡•§ ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§µ‡§ø‡§£‡§ø‡§Æ‡§è‡§£ ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§û‡•ç‡§ö‡§ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§¶‡•Å‡§™‡§ø‡§Ö‡§µ‡§û‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏‡•ã ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§£‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡•ã ‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡•§ [ ‡§¶‡•á‡§µ, ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡§ø ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§ó‡•á‡§π‡•á ‡§™‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§™‡•ç‡§§‡•ã‡§Ω‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡§É‡•§ ‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡§ø‡§Æ‡§Ø‡•á‡§® ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ö‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§á‡§§‡§ø‡•§ ]

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**( ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§ó‡§§‡§Æ‡•ç ) ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§≠‡•ã ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏, ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ß‡•Å‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§π‡•ã ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂‡§ø‡§§‡•ã ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡•á‡§π‡§É‡•§ ‡§ï‡•Å‡§§‡§É‡•§

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

** RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî**(With dejection, to himself) Here then (tad) has been opened by Fate the door of our initiation into grief (soka-dik·π£ƒÅ). Heart, be steady, there is something even more distressing to be heard by you. (Aloud) Good [friend ], that good man is known [lit. heard ] to affectionate towards his friends.

** Puru·π£a‚Äî**He is the dear friend of this Vi·π£·πáudƒÅsa.

RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî(To himself) Here is iniminent (abhyarah) that fall of the thunderbolt in the form of grief for the heart.

** Puru·π£a‚Äî**Then by Vis·πáudƒÅsa was Candragupta requested today, in a manner worthy of the affection for [his] friend.

** RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî**Tell [me] to what effect.

** Puru·π£a‚Äî**‚ÄòYour Majesty, there is more than enough (paryƒÅpta) money in my house. Let [my] dear friend CandanadƒÅsa be released in exchange for that.‚Äô

** RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî**(To himself) Bravo ! O Vi·π£nudƒÅsa, bravo ! Oh ! the affection for [your] friend has [well] been shown [by you]. Why?

Here that wealth of you, a merchant, despite your [inherent] nature as a merchant (varahtvepi) has served its purpose [wealth] to abandon which, dear [to every one], you resolved, when the friend was in difficulty, [and] for which sons kill their fathers, and fathers their sons, like enemies, and friends give up their affection toward friends.

(Aloud) Good [friend], then what was done by Maurya, thus addressed [by Vi·π£·πáudƒÅsa ] ?

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**( ‡§ñ‡§°‡•ç‡§ó‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø ) ‡§®‡§®‡•ç‡§µ‡§®‡•á‡§® ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•Å‡§π‡•É‡§¶‡§æ ‡§®‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡•á‡§®‡•§ ‡§™‡§∂‡•ç‡§Ø

‡§®‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡•ã‡§Ω‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§ú‡§≤548‡§ú‡§≤‡§¶‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡•ã‡§Æ‡§∏‡§Ç‡§ï‡§æ‡§∂‡§Æ‡•Ç‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§ø-

‡§∏‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§ï‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∏‡§Æ‡§∞‡§®‡§ø‡§ï‡§∑‡•á‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§∏‡§æ‡§∞‡§É ‡§™‡§∞‡•à‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡•á
‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡•ç‡§®‡•á‡§π‡§æ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§µ‡§∂‡§Æ‡§ß‡•Å‡§®‡§æ ‡§∏‡§æ‡§π‡§∏‡•á ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§®‡§ø‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡•á‡••‡•ß‡•Ø‡••

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

By you, O saintly [one] is being secured [ lit., collected] fame, like that of Sibi by the protection of one who has taken refuge (saranƒÅgata ) [ in you], even in the absence of [your] friend.

(Aloud) Good [friend], now go quickly [and] prevent Visnudasa from entering into fire. I too shall cause CandanadƒÅsa to be freed from [imminent] death.

**Puru·π£a‚Äî**Now, by what means again would the Noble one Cause CandanadƒÅsa to be freed from death?

RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî(Drawing his sword) Why [or I say, nanu] by this sword, [my] friend in [my] resolve [or doing ]. See

This my sword, with [its] form similar [in hue] to that of a cloud surcharged with water, horripilated as though on account of its eagerness for [lit., faith in] battle, having formed friendship with [my] hand, with its strength seen on the touchstone of battle, on account of the excellence (utkar·π£a) of its quality (sattva ) by [my] enemies, is appointing me, now helpless (vivasa), owing to [my] affection for [my] friend, to [an act of] rashness (sƒÅhasa).

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú, ‡§è‡§µ‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•á‡§ü‡•ç‡§†‡§ø‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§ú‡•Ä‡§µ‡§ø‡§¶‡§™‡•ç‡§™‡§¶‡§æ549‡§£‡§™‡§ø‡§∏‡•Å‡§£‡§ø‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∏‡§Æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§™‡§æ‡§ï‡§£‡§ø‡§™‡§°‡§ø‡§¶‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ß‡•Å ‡§£ ‡§∏‡§ï‡•ç‡§£‡•ã‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§§‡•Å‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§ó‡§ø‡§£‡•Ä‡§Ö ‡§™‡§°‡§ø‡§µ‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡•Å‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§®‡§ø‡§£‡§æ‡§Æ‡§π‡•á‡§Ü ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡§∏‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§æ ‡§§‡•Å‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡•á‡§¶‡§ø‡§ü‡•ç‡§†‡§ø‡§Ü ‡§¶‡§ø‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡•§ ‡§§‡§æ ‡§ï‡§∞‡•á‡§π‡§ø ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§™‡§π‡§æ ‡§∏‡§¶‡•á‡§π‡§£‡§ø‡§£‡•ç‡§£‡§è‡•§ [‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø, ‡§è‡§µ ‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§ú‡•Ä‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡§™‡§ø‡§∂‡•Å‡§®‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡§Æ‡§¶‡§∞‡•ç‡§∂ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§™‡§æ‡§ï‡§®‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡§ø‡§§‡§Ç ‡§∏‡§æ‡§ß‡•Å ‡§® ‡§∂‡§ï‡•ç‡§®‡•ã‡§Æ‡§ø ‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡•Ä‡§Ø ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§ø ‡§Æ‡•Å‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡•Ä‡§§‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§∑‡•á‡§ï ‡§Ö‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§æ ‡§Ø‡•Ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§æ ‡§á‡§§‡§ø‡•§ ‡§§‡§§‡•ç‡§ï‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§∏‡§æ‡§¶ ‡§∏‡§¶‡•á‡§π ‡§®‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§£‡§Ø‡•á‡§®‡•§]

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§∏‡•ã‡§Ω‡§π‡§Æ‡§®‡•Å‡§≠‡•Ç‡§§‡§≠‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡•É‡§µ‡§Ç‡§∂‡§µ‡§ø‡§®‡§æ‡§∂‡§É ‡§∏‡•Å‡§π‡•É‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§π‡•á‡§§‡•Å‡§∞‡§®‡§æ‡§•‡•ã‡§Ç‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡•É‡§π‡•Ä‡§§‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ß‡•á‡§Ø ‡§Ø‡§•‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§•‡•ã‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‡•§

** ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§É‚Äî**( ‡§∏‡§π‡§∞‡•ç‡§∑‡•á ‡§™‡•Å‡§®‡§É ‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§Ø‡•ã‡§É ‡§™‡§§‡§ø‡§§‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ ) ‡§π‡•ã‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£‡§π‡•á ‡§¶‡§ø‡§ü‡•ç‡§†‡§ø‡§Ü ‡§ü‡§ø‡§ü‡•ç‡§†‡•ã‡§∏‡§ø‡•§ [‡§Ü‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á ‡§¶‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ã‡§Ω‡§∏‡§ø‡•§]

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§≠‡§¶‡•ç‡§∞, ‡§â‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•ã‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§≤‡§Æ‡§ø‡§¶‡§æ‡§®‡•Ä ‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§π‡§∞‡§£‡•á‡§®‡•§ ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡•á‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§æ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å ‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§è‡§∑ ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏ ‡§Æ‡§∞‡§£‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§Æ‡•ã‡§ö‡§Ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø‡•§

( ‡§á‡§§‡§ø ‡§®‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡•ã‡§Ω‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§ø‡§§‡§ø ‡•¨-‡•ß‡•Ø ‡§™‡§†‡§®‡•ç‡§®‡§æ‡§ï‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ñ‡§°‡•ç‡§ó‡§É ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§§‡§ø‡•§ )

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

** ‡§∞‡§æ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§∏‡§É‚Äî**‡§Ö‡§π‡•ã554 ‡§Ö‡§π‡•ã !”) ‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§¨‡•ã‡§ß‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§æ‡§£‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø‡§¨‡§ü‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§®‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ó‡§É‡•§ ‡§ï‡•Å‡§§‡§É‡•§

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

** Pusu·π£a‚Äî**May it please the respectworthy [lit. the feet of [e] minister. It just (tƒÅvat) happened here that the noble ka≈£adƒÅsa was first ordered by the accursed Candragupta to taken to] ths place of execution. And he, having been ken away [per force] from the place of execution, was taken to another country. Then by the accursed Candragupta was the enkindled fire in the form of anger at the thought‚Äî‘why as this blunder committed? caused to be extinguised by the slaughter [lit. death] of the person in charge of the execution. Since then the executioners, [whenever] they see some person or the other with a sword taken [in his hand] [and] a Yetranger, either in front of or behind [themselves], then, very carefully guarding their own life, [they] kill the condemned victim. Therefore, by the respectworthy minister, going thus with the sword taken [in hand], would be hastened the death of the President [of the Guild] CandanadƒÅsa. (Exit)

** RƒÅk·π£asa‚Äî** Oh, [how] difficult to comprehend is the course of the policy of the chap Canakya. Why ?

‡§Ö‡§• ‡§® ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§ï‡§Ç ‡§§‡§æ‡§¶‡•É555‡§ï‡•ç‡§ï‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§•‡§Ç ‡§®‡•Å ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§æ‡§µ‡§Ø‡•á-

( ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ö‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø )

‡§®‡§æ‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§®‡§ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ç‡§∂‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§•‡§Æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡§π ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•á ‡§ò‡§æ‡§§‡§ï‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§ò‡§æ‡§§‡•á
‡§®‡•Ä‡§§‡§ø‡§É ‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ï‡§ü‡§Ø‡§§‡§ø ‡§´‡§≤‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§§‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•§
‡§î‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡•Ä‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§® ‡§Ø‡•Å‡§ï‡•ç‡§§‡§Ç‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§∏‡•Å‡§π‡•É‡§¶‡§ø ‡§ó‡§§‡•á ‡§Æ‡§§‡•ç‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡•á556 ‡§ö‡§æ‡§§‡§ø‡§ò‡•ã‡§∞‡§æ‡§Ç
‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡§Ç ‡§ú‡•ç‡§û‡§æ‡§§‡§Æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§§‡§®‡•Å‡§Æ‡§π‡§Æ‡§ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Ç ‡§®‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§Ø‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§≤‡•ç‡§™‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Æ‡§ø‡••‡•®‡•ß‡••

( ‡§á‡§§‡§ø557 ‡§®‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§É)

‡§á‡§§‡§ø ‡§ï‡§™‡§ü‡§™‡§æ‡§∂‡•ã ‡§®‡§æ‡§Æ ‡§™‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡•ã‡§Ω‡§ô‡•ç‡§ï‡§É‡•§

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

If further (ca) [≈öaka·π≠adƒÅsa] were led into my vicinity by the approval (mata) of the enemy, why at all, were the persons appointed to the task of execution, killed in anger by him? If [the rescue of [≈öaka·π≠adƒÅsa] were not a fake [or hoax], how could he, display that mean [cheating in the form of a forged letter]‚Äîmy mind that has thus mounted on [i. e. started] guessing [or inferring], does not see [any] definite conclusion.

(Thanking)

This is not the time for the sword, when here there is the killing straight away (prathamam) [of the condemned victim CandanadƒÅsa] at the hands of the executioners [asreported by the man]. Policy manifests [i. e. yields] fruit after [some] time. What is to be done with it here? A state of indifference is not proper when the dear friend has fallen into an extremely terrible calamity for my sake.Known [is now the remedy]. I shall offer my own person here as his ransom.

(With this, exit).

Thus ends the Sixth Act called
‚ÄúThe False Noose‚Äù

** ‡§µ‡§ú‡•ç‡§∞‡§≤‡•ã‡§Æ‡§æ‚Äî**‡§ì‡§∏‡§≤‡•á‡§π‡§Ö‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§æ ‡§ì‡§∏‡§≤‡•á‡§π‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§µ‡•á‡§π ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£‡§π‡•á558 ‡§Ö‡§¨‡•á‡§π‡•§ [‡§Ö‡§™‡§∏‡§∞‡§§ ‡§Ü‡§∞‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§Ö‡§™‡§∏‡§∞‡§§‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§™‡•á‡§§ ‡§Æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∑‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§™‡•á‡§§ ]

[ ‡§Ø‡§¶‡•Ä‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§• ‡§∞‡§ï‡•ç‡§∑‡§ø‡§§‡•Å‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§£‡§æ‡§®‡•ç ‡§µ‡§ø‡§≠‡§µ‡§æ‡§®‡•ç‡§ï‡•Å‡§≤‡§Ç ‡§ï‡§≤‡§§‡•ç‡§∞ ‡§ö‡•§

[ ‡§≠‡§µ‡§§‡§ø ‡§™‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§∑‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ‡§ß‡§ø‡§∞‡•ç‡§Æ‡§∞‡§£‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§∏‡•á‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•á‡§Ω‡§™‡§•‡•ç‡§Ø‡•á‡•§

‡§§‡§æ ‡§ú‡§¶‡§ø ‡§£ ‡§™‡§¶‡§ø‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§π‡§§‡§æ ‡§è‡§π ‡§™‡•á‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡§π ‡§è‡§Ö‡§Ç ‡§≤‡§æ‡§Ü‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§Ø‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡§ø‡§£‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•á‡§ü‡•ç‡§†‡§ø‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‚Äî

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

ACT VII

(Then enter the CandƒÅla (Executioner) Vajraloman)

**Vajraloman‚Äî**Move away, gentlemen, move away. Go away, men, go away.

If you wish to save your life, riches (vibhavƒÅn) family and wife, then keep away [i.e.avoid], far, far off (sudhirera), [what is ] hostile [lit. unwholesome] to the king, as it [lit. which] would be fraught with danger (vi-sama.uneven).

Moreover,

There occurs (bhavati) [either] disease [or in extreme cases] death of men, when [something] unwholesome is taken up [or resorted to] (sevrta). When [something] unwholesome to the king, however (punah ), is taken up, even the entire family has its existence brought to a termination (mriyate).

Now (tad) if you do not believe [this ], then look at this President of the Merchant Guild, CandanadƒÅsa, author (kƒÅrƒ±n)

(‡§§‡§§‡§É ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§µ‡§ø‡§∂‡§§‡§ø ‡§¶‡•ç‡§µ‡§ø‡§§‡•Ä‡§Ø‡§ö‡§£‡•ç‡§°‡§æ‡§≤‡•á‡§® ‡§¨‡§ø‡§≤‡•ç‡§µ‡§™‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§£‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§ó‡§§‡•ã ‡§µ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§µ‡•á‡§∂‡§ß‡§æ‡§∞‡•Ä ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§≤‡§Ç ‡§∏‡•ç‡§ï‡§Ç‡§ß‡•á‡§®‡§æ‡§¶‡§æ‡§Ø ‡§ï‡•Å‡§ü‡•Å‡§Æ‡•ç‡§¨‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§™‡•Å‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§ö‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§ó‡§Æ‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§∂‡•ç‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§É)

** ‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§É562‚Äî** ( ‡§∏‡§¨‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡§Æ‡•ç ) ‡§π‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡•Ä563 ‡§π‡§¶‡•ç‡§ß‡•Ä ‡§Ö‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§∞‡§ø‡§∏‡§æ‡§£‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø ‡§£‡§ø‡§ö‡•ç‡§ö‡§Ç ‡§ö‡§æ‡§∞‡§ø‡§§-

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

of [things] hostile [lit. unwholesome] to the king with his wife and son, being taken to the place of execution. (Looking up inspace) Noble ones, what do you say? whether (in) there is anymeans of [his] release? Noble ones, there (is) [such a means] if he surrenders the family-members of Minister RƒÅk·π£asa. (Again looking up in space). What do you say ‚Äòthis [CandanadƒÅsa] affectionate towards one who has thrown himself on his protection, would not, for the sake of just his own life, do such an unworthy deed (a-kƒÅrya)?’ Noble ones, then know for certain (avadhƒÅrayata) his auspicious course [to the yonder world]. Whatuse, now, your thinking about counter measures here [i.e.in this respect]?

(Then enter CandanadƒÅsa being followed by the other CandƒÅla Elvapatra, and wearing the dress of a condemned criminal having taken the stake on his shoulder, and being followed by his wife and son.)

CandanadƒÅsa‚Äî(With tears) Alas \‡•§ Fie ! Alas \‡•§ A salutation to Death I that of even persons like us ever afraid of [any] deviation (bhanga) [lit. break ] from [the proper] course of life (caritra), there takes place(bhavati?) death such as is befitting,

(‡§∏‡§Æ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§æ‡§¶‡§µ‡§≤‡•ã‡§ï‡•ç‡§Ø) ‡§≠‡•ã ‡§™‡§ø‡§Ö‡§µ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏ ‡§µ‡§ø‡§π‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏, ‡§ï‡§π‡§Ç ‡§™‡§°‡§ø‡§µ‡§Ö‡§£‡§Ç ‡§µ‡§ø ‡§£ ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§™‡§°‡§ø‡§µ‡§ú‡•ç‡§ú‡§∏‡§ø‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§π ‡§µ‡§æ ‡§¶‡•Å‡§≤‡•ç‡§≤‡§π‡§æ ‡§§‡•á ‡§ï‡•ç‡§ñ‡•Å ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£‡•Å‡§∏‡§æ ‡§ú‡•á ‡§è‡§¶‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏‡§ø ‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡•á ‡§¶‡§ø‡§†‡•ç‡§†‡§ø‡§µ‡§π‡•á‡§µ‡§ø ‡§ö‡§ø‡§ü‡•ç‡§†‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡•§ (‡§∏‡§µ‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡§Æ‡•ç564‡•§ “‡§ö‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§®‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏‡§É – ( ‡§∏‡§¨‡§æ‡§ß‡•ç‡§Ø‡§Æ‡•ç)‡•§”)) ‡§è‡§¶‡•á ‡§Ö‡§π‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§™‡§ø ‡§Ö‡§µ‡§Ö‡§∏‡•ç‡§∏‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§Ç‡§∏‡•Å‡§™‡§æ‡§¶‡§Æ‡•á‡§§‡•ç‡§§‡§ï‡•á‡§£ ‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§¶‡§™‡§¶‡•Ä‡§Ü‡§∞‡§æ ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§∏‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∞‡•ã‡§∞‡•ç‡§π‡§ø ‡§ï‡§π‡§Ç‡§µ‡§ø ‡§£‡§ø‡§µ‡§§‡§Æ‡§æ‡§£‡§æ ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§µ‡§†‡•ç‡§†‡§Æ‡§æ565‡§£‡§∏‡•ã ‡§Ö‡§¶‡•Ä‡§£‡§µ‡§Ö‡§£‡§æ ‡§µ‡§æ‡§π‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§Ü‡§è ‡§¶‡§ø‡§†‡•ç‡§†‡§è ‡§Æ‡§Ç ‡§Ö‡§£‡•Å‡§ó‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§®‡•ç‡§¶‡§ø‡•§ [‡§Æ‡•ã ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø ‡§µ‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§£‡•Å‡§¶‡§æ‡§∏, ‡§ï‡§•‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§ø‡§µ‡§ö‡§®‡§Æ‡§™‡§ø ‡§® ‡§Æ‡•á ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡§ø‡§™‡§¶‡•ç‡§Ø‡§∏‡•á‡•§ ‡§Ö‡§•‡§µ‡§æ ‡§¶‡•Å‡§∞‡•ç‡§≤‡§≠‡§æ‡§∏‡•ç‡§§‡•á ‡§ñ‡§≤‡•Å ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡•Å‡§∑‡§æ ‡§Ø ‡§è‡§§‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§ø‡§®‡•ç‡§ï‡§æ‡§≤‡•á ‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡§ø‡§™‡§•‡•á‡§Ω‡§™‡§ø ‡§§‡§ø‡§∑‡•ç‡§†‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡•§….‡§è‡§§‡•á‡§Ω‡§∏‡•ç‡§Æ‡§æ‡§ï‡§Ç ‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§ø‡§Ø‡§µ‡§Ø‡§∏‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§Ö‡§∂‡•ç‡§∞‡•Å‡§™‡§æ‡§§‡§Æ‡§æ‡§§‡•ç‡§∞‡•á‡§£ ‡§ï‡•É‡§§‡§™‡•ç‡§∞‡§§‡•Ä‡§ï‡§æ‡§∞‡§æ‡§É ‡§∏‡•ç‡§µ‡§∂‡§∞‡•Ä‡§∞‡•à‡§É ‡§ï‡§•‡§Æ‡§™‡§ø ‡§®‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§§‡§Æ‡§æ‡§®‡§æ‡§É ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§µ‡§∞‡•ç‡§ß‡§ø‡§§‡§∂‡•ã‡§ï‡§¶‡•Ä‡§®‡§µ‡§¶‡§®‡§æ ‡§¨‡§æ‡§∑‡•ç‡§™‡§ó‡•Å‡§∞‡•Å‡§ï‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§¶‡•É‡§∑‡•ç‡§ü‡•ç‡§Ø‡§æ ‡§Æ‡§æ‡§Æ‡§®‡•Å‡§ó‡§ö‡•ç‡§õ‡§®‡•ç‡§§‡§ø‡•§ ]

(‡§á‡§§‡§ø ‡§™‡§∞‡§ø‡§ï‡•ç‡§∞‡§æ‡§Æ‡§§‡§ø)

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

the class (Jana) of thieves‡•§Or rather, in the eyes of the cruel (n·πõsansa), there is no distinction between the indifferent (udƒÅsƒ´na), [ones] and others. For [or to explain the same]‚Äî

What [an inexplicable] insistence indeed, [is there] on the part of the hunters to kill the innocent deer, living on blades of grass, through fear of derth, leaving flesh (ƒÅma·π£a) [to itself] ?

(Looking around) O dear friend Vi·π£·πáudƒÅsa, how do you not give me even [so much as] a word in reply? Or rather; difficult to come across, are indeed those men, who [ would] so much as (api) stand within the range of sight, at this hour [juncture lit. time]. Here our dear friends, with counter-measures adopted by the mere shedeing of tears, returning with great difficulty (kathamapi) with their bodies, their faces woe-begone (dina) on account of excessive [lit. increased] grief, are following me with eyes heavy (guruka) with tears.
